death_place.zh-cn: 台北市北投区台北荣民总医院
death_place.en: Taipei Veterans General Hospital, Beitou District, Taipei

description.zh-cn: 中国近代政治家、书法家，中华民国开国元勋之一。曾长期担任监察院院长达34年，被誉为“当代草圣”。
description.en: A modern Chinese politician, calligrapher, and one of the founding fathers of the Republic of China. He served as the President of the Control Yuan for 34 years and is hailed as the 'Contemporary Sage of Cursive Script'.

en: Control Yuan of the Republic of China

description.zh-cn: 中华民国最高监察机关。
description.en: The highest supervisory agency of the Republic of China.

description.zh-cn: 中华民国政治家、军事家，曾任中华民国总统。
description.en: A Chinese politician and military leader who served as the President of the Republic of China.

description.zh-cn: 中华民国政治人物，曾接任于右任为监察院院长。
description.en: A politician of the Republic of China who succeeded Yu Youren as the President of the Control Yuan.

description.zh-cn: 1925年至1948年间中华民国的国家统治机关。
description.en: The state governing body of the Republic of China between 1925 and 1948.

description.zh-cn: 中华民国政治人物，于右任的前任监察院院长。
description.en: A politician of the Republic of China and Yu Youren's predecessor as President of the Control Yuan.

description.zh-cn: 中华民国时期陕西省的最高行政机关。
description.en: The highest administrative body of Shaanxi Province during the Republic of China era.

description.zh-cn: 中华民国军事将领，曾接任于右任为陕西省政府主席。
description.en: A military general of the Republic of China who succeeded Yu Youren as the Chairman of the Shaanxi Provincial Government.

en: Ministry of the Interior of the Republic of China

description.zh-cn: 中华民国政府负责国内民政事务的部门。
description.en: The department of the ROC government responsible for domestic civil affairs.

description.zh-cn: 中华民国政治人物，曾任国务总理。
description.en: A politician of the Republic of China who served as Premier.

description.zh-cn: 于右任的元配妻子。
description.en: Yu Youren's first wife.

description.zh-cn: 由马相伯创办的位于上海的著名高等学府。
description.en: A renowned institution of higher learning in Shanghai founded by Ma Xiangbo.

description.zh-cn: 中国近代民主革命家，中华民国国父。
description.en: A Chinese revolutionary, statesman, and founding father of the Republic of China.

description.zh-cn: 由孙中山等人在日本东京成立的革命组织。
description.en: A revolutionary organization founded by Sun Yat-sen and others in Tokyo, Japan.

description.zh-cn: 晚清时期的一个革命团体。
description.en: A revolutionary group during the late Qing dynasty.

description.zh-cn: 清末官员，曾任陕甘总督。
description.en: An official in the late Qing dynasty who served as the Viceroy of Shaanxi and Gansu.

description.zh-cn: 于右任的第一本诗集，因讥讽时政而遭清廷查禁。
description.en: Yu Youren's first collection of poems, which was banned by the Qing court for satirizing current affairs.

description.zh-cn: 中国教育家，震旦学院及复旦大学的创办人。
description.en: A Chinese educator, founder of Aurora University and Fudan University.

description.zh-cn: 于右任在上海创办的具有革命倾向的日报。
description.en: A daily newspaper with revolutionary tendencies founded by Yu Youren in Shanghai.

description.zh-cn: 于右任在上海创办的日报，后遭清廷控告而停刊。
description.en: A daily newspaper founded by Yu Youren in Shanghai, which was later forced to cease publication after being sued by the Qing government.

description.zh-cn: 中国历史上最后一个封建王朝。
description.en: The last imperial dynasty of China.

description.zh-cn: 于右任在上海法租界创办的日报，因报导伊藤博文遇刺事件遭查封。
description.en: A daily newspaper founded by Yu Youren in the Shanghai French Concession, which was shut down for its coverage of the assassination of Itō Hirobumi.

description.zh-cn: 东亚国家。
description.en: A country in East Asia.

description.zh-cn: 于右任创办的积极宣传民主革命的报纸。
description.en: A newspaper founded by Yu Youren that actively promoted democratic revolution.

nodes.id: 中华民国临时政府 (南京)

zh-cn: 中华民国临时政府 (南京)
en: Provisional Government of the Republic of China (1912)

description.zh-cn: 辛亥革命后由革命党人建立的中国第一个共和制政权。
description.en: The first republican regime in China, established by revolutionaries after the Xinhai Revolution.

description.zh-cn: 中华民国政府负责交通与通信事务的部门。
description.en: The department of the ROC government responsible for transportation and communications.

description.zh-cn: 由孙中山领导的，旨在维护《中华民国临时约法》的军事政治运动。
description.en: A military and political movement led by Sun Yat-sen to protect the Provisional Constitution of the Republic of China.

description.zh-cn: 民国初年响应孙中山护法运动而在陕西成立的军队。
description.en: An army formed in Shaanxi during the early Republic of China in response to Sun Yat-sen's Constitutional Protection Movement.

description.zh-cn: 中华民国军事将领，曾推举于右任为陕西靖国军总司令。
description.en: A military general of the Republic of China who nominated Yu Youren as the commander-in-chief of the Shaanxi Pacification Army.

description.zh-cn: 于右任等人于1922年创办的大学，于右任为首任校长。
description.en: A university founded in 1922 by Yu Youren and others, with Yu serving as its first president.

description.zh-cn: 中华民国时期军阀，国民革命军将领。
description.en: A warlord during the Republic of China era and a general in the National Revolutionary Army.

description.zh-cn: 欧亚大陆北部的社会主义国家。
description.en: A socialist state that spanned much of Eurasia.

description.zh-cn: 由中国国民党领导，旨在统一中国、推翻北洋政府的军事行动。
description.en: A military campaign led by the Kuomintang to unify China and overthrow the Beiyang government.

zh-cn: 国立西北农林专科学校

description.zh-cn: 位于陕西的著名高等学府，其前身由于右任筹备创建并任首任校长。
description.en: A renowned institution of higher learning in Shaanxi, whose predecessor was founded by Yu Youren, who also served as its first president.

description.zh-cn: 2014年在台湾发生的一场学生与公民运动，期间示威者占领了立法院议场。
description.en: A student and civic movement in Taiwan in 2014, during which protesters occupied the legislative chamber.

description.zh-cn: 台湾社会运动人士，曾参与破坏玉山上的于右任铜像。
description.en: A Taiwanese social activist involved in the vandalism of the Yu Youren statue on Yushan.

description.zh-cn: 于右任长子，曾任中华民国外交官。
description.en: Yu Youren's eldest son, who served as a diplomat for the Republic of China.

description.zh-cn: 于右任次子，曾任中华民国外交官。
description.en: Yu Youren's second son, who served as a diplomat for the Republic of China.

description.zh-cn: 于右任三子，计算机专家。
description.en: Yu Youren's third son, a computer expert.

description.zh-cn: 于右任之女。
description.en: Yu Youren's daughter.

description.zh-cn: 于右任女婿，于念慈的丈夫。
description.en: Yu Youren's son-in-law, husband of Yu Nianci.

description.zh-cn: 担任行宪后第一任中华民国监察院院长，直至逝世。
description.en: Served as the first President of the Control Yuan of the Republic of China after the constitution was enacted, holding the position until his death.

description.zh-cn: 担任国民政府时期第三任监察院院长。
description.en: Served as the third President of the Control Yuan during the Nationalist Government period.

description.zh-cn: 在蒋中正担任总统期间，于右任任监察院院长。
description.en: Yu Youren served as the President of the Control Yuan while Chiang Kai-shek was the President.

description.zh-cn: 李嗣璁在于右任逝世后接替其监察院院长职务。
description.en: Li Si-tsung succeeded Yu Youren as the President of the Control Yuan after Yu's death.

description.zh-cn: 于右任接替赵戴文担任国民政府监察院院长。
description.en: Yu Youren succeeded Zhao Daiwen as the President of the Control Yuan of the Nationalist Government.

description.zh-cn: 宋哲元接替于右任担任陕西省政府主席。
description.en: Song Zheyuan succeeded Yu Youren as the Chairman of the Shaanxi Provincial Government.

description.zh-cn: 在许世英担任国务总理期间，于右任任内务总长。
description.en: Yu Youren served as the Minister of the Interior while Xu Shiying was the Premier.

description.zh-cn: 高仲林为于右任的元配妻子。
description.en: Gao Zhonglin was Yu Youren's first wife.

description.zh-cn: 因遭清廷通缉流亡上海，化名“刘学裕”进入震旦公学学习。
description.en: After becoming a fugitive wanted by the Qing court, he fled to Shanghai and enrolled in Aurora University under the alias 'Liu Xueyu'.

description.zh-cn: 于右任于1905年在日本结识孙中山并加入同盟会，成为其追随者。
description.en: Yu Youren met Sun Yat-sen in Japan in 1905, joined the Tongmenghui, and became his follower.

description.zh-cn: 因于右任刊印《半哭半笑楼诗草》，时任陕甘总督升允以“逆竖昌言革命，大逆不道”的罪名密奏朝廷，导致于右任被革除功名并遭通缉。
description.en: Due to Yu Youren's publication of 'Poems from the Half-Crying Half-Laughing Tower', Sheng Yun, the Viceroy of Shaanxi and Gansu, secretly reported him to the throne on charges of 'treasonous remarks advocating revolution,' leading to Yu being stripped of his official honors and becoming a wanted man.

description.zh-cn: 此诗集的刊印导致于右任被官府告发为革命党并遭通缉。
description.en: The publication of this poetry collection led to Yu Youren being accused by the authorities as a revolutionary and becoming a wanted fugitive.

description.zh-cn: 在于右任就读震旦学院期间，院长马相伯十分赏识他。
description.en: During Yu Youren's studies at Aurora University, President Ma Xiangbo held him in high regard.

description.zh-cn: 因负面报导遭到清廷控告，被迫停刊。
description.en: Forced to cease publication after being sued by the Qing government for negative reporting.

description.zh-cn: 因报导伊藤博文遇刺事件倾向性明显，遭到日方抗议，租界当局查封了该报。
description.en: Due to its biased coverage of the assassination of Itō Hirobumi, the newspaper faced protests from the Japanese side, leading to its seizure by the concession authorities.

relationships.target: 中华民国临时政府 (南京)

description.zh-cn: 推举于右任担任陕西靖国军总司令。
description.en: Nominated Yu Youren to be the commander-in-chief of the Shaanxi Pacification Army.

description.zh-cn: 其领导的广东军政府任命于右任为陕西督军。
description.en: The Guangzhou Military Government led by him appointed Yu Youren as the Military Governor of Shaanxi.

description.zh-cn: 参与创办上海大学，并担任首任校长。
description.en: Participated in the founding of Shanghai University and served as its first president.

description.zh-cn: 代表中国国民党赴苏联促使冯玉祥回国参加国民革命军北伐。
description.en: On behalf of the Kuomintang, traveled to the Soviet Union to persuade Feng Yuxiang to return to China and participate in the Northern Expedition.

description.zh-cn: 筹备建设国立西北农林专科学校（今西北农林科技大学），并就任首任校长。
description.en: He prepared for the establishment of the National Northwest Agricultural and Forestry College (now Northwest A&F University) and became its first president.

description.zh-cn: 在占领立法院事件中，示威群众拆下了由于右任题写的“立法院”匾额。
description.en: During the occupation of the Legislative Yuan, protesters removed the plaque inscribed with 'Legislative Yuan' written by Yu Youren.

description.zh-cn: 参与破坏并“砍头”了立于玉山顶的于右任铜像，以表达政治诉求。
description.en: Participated in vandalizing and 'beheading' the bronze statue of Yu Youren on Yushan to express political demands.
